titleStmt.title: The worlds wonder, or the Quakers blazing starr: with an astronomical judgment given upon the same, from 2 Cor. 11.13, 14, 15. Proving them to be altogether deluded by Satan, both in their judgments and walkings: together with a probable conjecture of the end of the world, and the estate of things in the interval. / By Edmund Skipp preacher of the Gospel unto the people at Bodenham in Herefordshire.
titleStmt.author: Skipp, Edmund.

titleStmt.title: The worlds wonder, or the Quakers blazing starr: with an astronomical judgment given upon the same, from 2 Cor. 11.13, 14, 15. Proving them to be altogether deluded by Satan, both in their judgments and walkings: together with a probable conjecture of the end of the world, and the estate of things in the interval. / By Edmund Skipp preacher of the Gospel unto the people at Bodenham in Herefordshire.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Hills, and are to be sold at the sign of Sir John Oldcastle near Py-corner.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Febr. 28. 1654"; 5 in imprint date crossed out.
